html:
Adds details

ABUJA, Oct 5 (Reuters) - Nigerian stocks climbed to an eight-month high in late trades on Tuesday, led higher by banking shares and Airtel Africa, the third largest listed firm.

The all-share index .NGSEINDEX rose 1.09%, its fourth straight daily gain, to 40,682.73 points. Stocks hit a seven-month high last week. (Full Story)

Airtel Africa AIRTELAFRI.LG, which is also listed in London, gained 6.29% in Lagos on plans to buy back shares from minority shareholders, while Access Bank ACCESS.LG rose 3.28% after it sold $500 million perpetual bonds to boost its capital. (Full Story) (Full Story)

Shares in 26 companies rose on Tuesday, while 19 declined and another 100 recorded no trades.


(Reporting by Chijioke Ohuocha
Editing by Gareth Jones)
